jalse.entities

Interface Entity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ActionScheduler<Entity>, AttributeContainer, EntityContainer, Identifiable, Taggable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEntity

    public interface Entity
extends EntityContainer, Identifiable, AttributeContainer, Taggable, ActionScheduler<Entity>
    Entity plays the greatest role in the overall data model. An entity is representative of a single entity or group of entities with a defined identities. Entities have AttributeType as well as AttributeListener for trigger code upon add, removal or change of those attributes. Entities can create and kill other entities (tree-like structure) these events can be accessed by adding EntityListener.

    Entities can be wrapped and marked as specific entity types as long as the inheriting interface follows what is outlined in Entities. Entity have can have a number of types (subclasses of Entity) which can be used to identify a collection of entities with similar state or function.

    An example of how the type marking works: 
     
 public interface Animal extends Entity {}
 public interface FlyingAnimal extends Animal {}
 
 Entity e; // Previously created entity.
 e.markAsType(FlyingAnimal.class);
 
 assert e.isMarkedAsType(Animal.class);
    NOTE: Taking an entity asType(Class) is similar to casting but does not mark as the entity with the type.
    See Also:
    EntityContainer, DefaultEntityContainer, EntityListener, EntityFactory, Entities.asType(Entity, Class)

      • markAsType

        boolean markAsType(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> type)
        Adds the specified type to the entity. If any of the ancestry of this type are not associated to this entity they will also be added.
        Parameters:
        type - Entity type to add.
        Returns:
        Whether the type was not associated to the entity.

      • transfer

        boolean transfer(EntityContainer destination)
        Transfers this entity to the specified destination container.
        Parameters:
        destination - Target container.
        Returns:
        Whether the entity was transfered.

      • unmarkAsType

        boolean unmarkAsType(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> type)
        Removes the specified type from the entity. If this type is the ancestor of any other types associated to the entity they will be removed.
        Parameters:
        type - Entity type to remove.
        Returns:
        Whether the entity was previously associated to the type (or its any of its children).
